title: Will Intel lay off more than 15% of its workforce by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Intel announces and proceeds with laying off more than 15% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The layoffs must be explicitly confirmed by Intel through official statements or reports from at least two reputable news organizations such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post.

article_information.article_description: Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its massive workforce — about 15,000 jobs — as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD. The Santa Clara, California-based company said Thursday it is also suspen…
article_information.article_title: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around
article_information.article_content:
Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its huge workforce about 15,000 jobs as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD.

title: Will the number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits be higher in July 2024 than in July 2023?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits in any week of July 2024 is higher than the number in the corresponding week of July 2023. The data must be reported by an official source such as the U.S. Department of Labor.

article_information.article_description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains broadly healthy. Jobless claims for the week ending July 27 climbed by 14,000 to249,000 from 235,000 the previous week, …
article_information.article_title: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year
article_information.article_content:

title: Will more than 23,000 farmers receive federal aid by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if more than 23,000 farmers, including Black and other minority farmers, receive federal aid from the USDA by August 31, 2024. The aid must be part of the $2 billion package announced for addressing past discrimination.

article_information.article_description: Black and other minority farmers are set to receive more than $2 billion in federal aid in response to decades of discrimination by the U.S. Department of Agriculture. President Joe Biden announced the payments Wednesday. The USDA says more than 23,000 farmer…

title: Will the USDA distribute the entire $2 billion federal aid to minority farmers by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the USDA distributes the entire $2 billion federal aid package to Black and other minority farmers by August 31, 2024. The aid is meant to address decades of discrimination.

article_information.article_description: Black and other minority farmers are set to receive more than $2 billion in federal aid in response to decades of discrimination by the U.S. Department of Agriculture. title: Will any legal challenges delay the distribution of the $2 billion federal aid to minority farmers by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if any legal challenges result in a delay of the distribution of the $2 billion federal aid to Black and other minority farmers by August 31, 2024.
